title: Bernoulli polynomials and sums of k-th powers

blocks.name: cbp
blocks.content: Declare the constant for the Bernoulli polynomial operator.

blocks.name: df-bpoly
blocks.content: Define the Bernoulli polynomials. Here we use well-founded recursion to define the Bernoulli polynomials. This agrees with most textbook definitions, although explicit formulas do exist. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 22-May-2014.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-bpoly(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  |- wceq(cbp, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, cc, cfv(cwrecs(clt, cn0, cmpt(s2, universe, csb(s3, cfv(chash, cdm(cv(s2))), co(co(cv(s1), cexp, cv(s3)), cmin, csu(s4, cdm(cv(s2)), co(co(cv(s3), cbc, cv(s4)), cmul, co(cfv(cv(s2), cv(s4)), cdiv, co(co(cv(s3), cmin, cv(s4)), caddc, nat1)))))))), cv(s0))))
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-bpoly(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4) {
  ‚ä¢ BernPoly =(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, s1 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ ‚Ü¶(wrecs(<, ‚Ñï0,(s2 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(# ` dom(s2))/ s3]((s1[^]s3)[-]sum(s4 ‚àà dom(s2),((s3[_C]s4)[√ó]((s2 ` s4)[√∑]((s3[-]s4)[+]1)))))))` s0))
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s3, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s3)
}

blocks.name: bpolydif
blocks.content: Calculate the difference between successive values of the Bernoulli polynomials. (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 16-May-2014.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2014.)

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)‚Üí sum(s0 ‚àà(0[...]c1),(s0[^]c0))=((((c0[+]1)[BernPoly](c1[+]1))[-]((c0[+]1)[BernPoly]0))[√∑](c0[+]1)))

  fsummulc2(s0, (c0[+]1), (0[...]c1), (s0[^]c0), (c0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0 ‚àß c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0))

  simpl(c0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, c1 ‚àà ‚Ñï0)
